column2: Summon your Grand Company-issued battle chocobo.
column3:
Born and bred in the city–state of Ishgard, the majority of company chocobos are geldings of the rouncey variety; however, massive destriers and miniature Belah'dian jennets are also raised to accommodate the builds of Roegadyn and
Lalafellin riders respectively.
column4:
Chocobos are stout-
hearted creatures, but
they have their limits.
  - Mimigun

column2: Use the odd-shaped horn gifted to you by the wandering minstrel to call a massive goobbue to your side.
column3:
Traded for a song by the High Satrap of a distant land, the secret to taming these creatures once thought to be unbreakable was introduced to Eorzea by a mysterious wandering minstrel who journeyed through the realm in the final
days before the Calamity.
column4:
Would that I had the
girth of a goobbue!
  - Nanamo Ul Namo

column2: Five years and a realm-shaking Calamity were not enough to break the bonds between you and your loyal steed. A single whistle and he will be at your side once again.
column3:
In the five years following your sudden disappearance from the Carteneau Flats, your ever-faithful chocobo spent each waking moment galloping across the realm in search of his lost master. His myriad adventures are nothing less than fantastical
and heartbreaking...but that is
a story for another day.
column4:
Go find the chocobo you
rode in on, and ride on out.
  - Sevrin

column2: Call into battle your suit of Garlond Ironworks-modified magitek armor.
column3: This suit of Garlean-developed reaper-class magitek battle armor has had its original control systems purged and replaced with a new, modified core built by Cid of the Garlond Ironworks.
column4:
At last, our very own
suit of magitek armor!
  - Cid Garlond

column2: Summon your fleet-footed battle coeurl, trained from a pup to recognize you as a friend...not food.
column3:
Native to the jungles of the Near East, coeurls were only recently introduced to Eorzea, brought over from faraway lands such as Thavnair by Ul'dahn nobles who thought to breed them as pets. Now, but a handful of skilled tamers living in recluse on the Pearl are
said to be able to train them.
column4:
Hey, good lookin'!
Catch my coeurl yet?
  - Swygrael

column2: Summon forth a riding ahriman, bound to this realm with powerful magicks guaranteed to never fade.
column3:
Though little is known of the void and the creatures which call the extra-dimensional realm home, scholars have discovered that there is a strict hierarchy amongst voidsent consisting of twelve distinct tiers. Ahrimans are believed to fall into the fifth, making them formidable foes...
when not enthralled by curses.
column4:
Ye'd 'ave t' be blinder'n an
ahriman wi' an eyepatch t'
miss the camp.
  - Baderon Tenfingers

column2: Summon forth the single-horned steed you befriended in the Black Shroud.
column3:
Not long ago, Eorzean unicorns numbered in the thousands, and could oft be seen roaming the Coerthas highlands in great majestic herds that would render the mountains white as snow. Poaching has caused the population to decline, and if it were not for your act of kindness,
there would be one fewer.
column4:
Your precious horses,
they're just unicorns with
a big empty forehead.
  - Chief Chocowacker

column2: Summon your mighty behemoth, trained from birth to carry you...not trample you underfoot like an ant.
column3:
Immediately following the Calamity, an adventurer returning to Gridania from Falcon's Nest in Coerthas claims to have happened upon a den of baby behemoths who had lost their mother. Despite objections from friends and family alike,
she kept the beasts, eventually
training them to serve as mounts.
column4:
Do not presume to
provoke the behemoth to
battle. You will die.
  - Meurise

column2: Summon your cavalry drake, trained by the drake whisperer of the Brotherhood of Ash.
column3:
Training a cavalry drake is a long and arduous process that begins the moment the scalekin hatches. Never allowed to see its mother, the creature is raised solely in the presence of a drake whisperer while being weaned on the incendiary glands of aged battle
drakes to ensure it is both
submissive and deadly.
column4:
You are as a lost kitten
that has wandered into
the drake's lair.
  - Zagozz Teh

column2: Summon your laurel goobbue, towering friend to the sylphs.
column3:
After having the moss and flowers growing upon his head pulled up and tossed aside like common weeds by a band of sylvan ne'er-do-wells, this quiet-mannered goobbue was taken in and cared for by the sylphs of Little Solace whose elders crafted for him
a magnificent laurel with
which to hide his scars.
column4:
Naught is as exhilarating
as a romp through the
forest on goobbueback.
  - Unknown

column2: Call into battle your gilded suit of magitek armor. Its golden coating serves to resist magicks while impressing members of the opposite sex.
column3:
It only took a few heated skirmishes with the allied city–states for Garlemald to realize that the magicks wielded by the realm's mages were too much for even the thickest of magitek armor plating. Alloyed gilding has since been discovered to dampen the
effects of elemental charges
and is now standard issue.
column4:
You ditched your magitek
armor!? Fool of a Lalafell!
  - Biggs

column2: Summon forth the single-horned steed with a temperament as black as his coat.
column3:
While it is no secret that it was the enigmatic Ascians who provided the beast tribes with nightmares, their reasons for doing so remain shrouded in mystery. Otherwise untamable, the single piercing tone of a magicked whistle is the only method known to soothe
the savage beasts.
column4:
See the nightmare for
reality, and ready thyself
for the coming chaos!
  - Urianger

column2: Summon forth your fat chocobo mount. Take care that there is sufficient room for his ample girth.
column3:
Playfully described by some as “large and in charge,” in truth, when summoned, this gluttonous gourmand will flap nary a feather unless a garland of gysahl greens is dangled before him─in which case not even the laws of nature can slow
the fat chocobo down.
column4:
Huff...huff...heave...heave...
  - Fat Chocobo

column2: Summon your cavalry elbst, raised from an egg by Pahh of Novv's Clutch.
column3:
To ensure his elbst do not find themselves at a disadvantage to swift-running chocobos, Pahh of Novv's Clutch clips the webbing on their feet at a young age, rendering them more capable of achieving high speeds on land─though they will ever be slower than their brethren
while underwater.
column4:
My elbst is your elbst.
  - Pahh

column2: Summon forth a bevy of bombs who will bear you in comfort upon a hovering palanquin.
column3: Upon learning that his creations were forever lacking the power to combust, 789th Order Acolyte Ba Go did what any master of explosives would─attach the bombs to the corners of an iron bench and create a floating coach.
column4:
Hack and slash and
tossy-boom. Bang and
boom and slashy-doom.♪
  - Goblin Diddy

column2: Summon forth Aithon, the legendary steed favored of the primal Ifrit. Its breath is said to be as hot as the seventh hell.
column3: Legend states that the Lord of the Inferno, Ifrit, forged this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the Amalj'aa in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth Xanthos, the legendary steed favored of the primal Garuda. At full gallop, it is said to be the very wind itself.
column3: Legend states that the Lady of the Vortex, Garuda, created this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the Ixal in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth Gullfaxi, the legendary steed favored of the primal Titan. Its powerful legs set off tremors that can be felt from malms away.
column3: Legend states that the Lord of Crags, Titan, wrought this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the kobolds in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth Enbarr, the legendary steed favored of the primal Leviathan. It is said to have been born of the surging waves.
column3: Legend states that the Lord of the Whorl, Leviathan, birthed this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the Sahagin in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth your fearless warlion to rule over the battlefield, such is his station as king of the beasts.
column3:
Early in the Sixth Astral Era, lions were brought over from the Near East and trained to serve as battle mounts for the Sultansworn of Ul'dah. Deemed unbreakable, those not sold to the Coliseum for venationes were released into the deserts of Thanalan where they eventually
reverted back to a feral state.
column4:
I, too, see the friends
I lost in the lions and
spinners...
  - Gregory

column2: Summon forth your fearless warbear, veteran of a thousand battles, to fill your enemies with dread.
column3: In generations past, warriors seeking fame and glory would journey out into the untamed wilds of Abalathia's Spine in search of the giant grizzled bears that roamed the mountains, and would wrestle the beasts into submission, riding their prizes back to civilization. That is, or die trying.
column4:
How do you like my
pets? Not too playful
for you, I hope?
  - Beast Trainer

column2: Summon forth your draught chocobo, a massive bird large and strong enough to bear two riders.
column3:
This heretofore unseen breed of chocobo was said to have been discovered by chocobo hunters searching for the legendary Chocobo Forest. Its enormous size would make it a fine pack chocobo, but its foul temper prevents it from completing even the simplest of tasks without the injury
of some poor rider.
column4:
The thing was thrice my
size and had already
maimed several keeps.
  - Battlewarden Ribald

column2: Summon forth your deadly direwolf, one of five pups found huddling together in the snow near the corpse of their slain mother.
column3: Mass cullings of the beasts during the Sixth Astral Era prompted naturalists to deem the species extinct. However, this claim was proved false when Ixali scouts discovered a lone pack roaming the sparsely inhabited mountains of Xelphatol.
column4:
I lost two good men
to these wolves.
  - Corentiaux the Colder

column2: Summon forth your Maelstrom-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.
column3:
After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage
during Frontline campaigns.
column4:
Hoof to neigh, Eorzea
knows not the horse for
one reason: the horsebird.
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth your Order of the Twin Adder-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.
column3:
After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage
during Frontline campaigns.
column4:
Hoof to neigh, Eorzea
knows not the horse for
one reason: the horsebird.
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth your Immortal Flames-issued warhorse and try to push from your mind the fact that your chocobo is sitting somewhere hungry and alone.
column3:
After witnessing dazzling demonstrations of how a warsteed might turn the tide of battle, the Grand Companies of Eorzea emptied their coffers at the feet of the Far Eastern uma bugyo, each seeking to put themselves at an advantage
during Frontline campaigns.
column4:
Hoof to neigh, Eorzea
knows not the horse for
one reason: the horsebird.
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth Markab, the legendary steed favored of the primal Ramuh. It is said to have been born of a single thunderbolt.
column3: Legend states that the Lord of Levin, Ramuh, drew forth this magicked steed from a nightmare offered by the sylphs in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth your ceremony chocobo, large enough to bear both you and your special someone.
column3:
Raised by Ishgard's master breeders for beauty and purity of stock, its snow white feathers are natural and, though fully developed, as soft as down. Temperament-wise, the bird is remarkably docile and one of few breeds
who will allow dual
riders upon its back.
column4:
Don't stand on ceremony,
tick-tock, tick-tock!
  - Helmhart

column2: Summon forth Sleipnir─undying steed of the elder primal Odin. His coat is as dark as void, while his eyes glow a sanguine red.
column3:
Blessed by the elder primal himself, Sleipnir will forever remain loyal to those who have proven themselves worthy. In addition to being fearless in battle, the dark steed is also able to manipulate his corporeal form to
accommodate any
rider, large or small.
column4:
If it hadn't been
for that horse...
   - Erik

column2: Summon forth Boreas, the legendary steed favored of the primal Shiva. His breath is said to beget the winter's storms.
column3: Legend states that the Lady of Frost, Shiva, birthed this magicked steed from a unicorn offered by her followers in sacrifice.
column4:
Nay is but a hoofbeat
away from neigh!
  - Uma Bugyo

column2: Summon forth your parade chocobo who, by the looks of him, has not marched in many parades.
column3:
Originally purchased by the Adventurers' Guild for use in festival parades, this portly steed quickly wore out his welcome by devouring a moon's worth of fodder in a single turn of the sun. Unable to pay the price of upkeep, the guild
passed the reigns to some-
one more “commendable.”
column4:
I'll be at the parade with
whomever else I can drag along.
  - Botulf

column2: Summon de forth your black de chocobo.
column3:
A purebred Ishgardian black chocobo, trained from birth by House Fortemps knight, Ser Haurchefant, and presented to you in a gesture of true friendship. The bird is slightly more muscular than you expected and exhibits the strange
habit of squatting
when left to itself.
column4:
Black chocobos are all well and
good, but the true reward is the
exoneration of your comrades.
   - Haurchefant

column2: Summon forth your adamantoise mount. He(?) is actually quite faster than he appears.
column3: Native to the Near Eastern island of Thavnair, adamantoises were long thought to be impossible to domesticate. However, through the efforts of both Ul'dahn zoologists and thaumaturges, a handful have been successfully trained not only to accept riders, but also wield ancient magicks which allow the colossal scalekin to fly.
column4:
M-Me? Perfectly fine!
S-Solid as an adamantoise!
  - Cocobezi

column2: Summon forth Kirin, Far Eastern king of the beasts.
column3:
Ask any man in Othard who rules the realm of beasts, and you will receive the same answer─Kirin. It is believed that the lion-like creature has walked the eastern lands for over a thousand years and
will only answer the
call of a hero it has
deemed worthy.
column4:
Even folk in the Far East
'eard that tale, I reckon.
  - Trachraet

column2: Call into battle your Allagan logistics system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled.
column3:
One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere was modified by Nero tol Scaeva into a personal
transportation device.
column4:
Her report also mentions a
violent encounter with a
sentry heavily augmented
by Allagan technology...
  - Rammbroes

column2: Summon forth a purebred Abalathian hoarhound named after its pack's legendary leader.
column3: Following the rise of Ishgard, hoarhounds all but disappeared from the Coerthas highlands. However, the shift in climate caused by the Calamity has seen the legendary beasts descend from their mountain dens once more.
column4:
A good hound keeps
his maw shut.
   - Latata

column2: Summon forth Midgardsormr, the slightly bigger one, but still not <Emphasis>the</Emphasis> big one.
column3: Only after proving your bravery in the face of countless perils has the Father of Dragons found you to be a worthy heir to the Light, and granted you a place upon his back.
column4:
Correct me if I'm wrong, but
if Midgardsormr had roared,
wouldn't we have heard it?
   - Moenbryda

column2: Summon forth your amber draught chocobo, a rare breed large and strong enough to bear two riders.
column3:
To Ishgardians, red represents true love and loyalty. To this wild chocobo from the Dravanian forelands, it meant capture at the hands of hunters who easily found a red chocobo sticking out like a sore thumb in the midst of all
his yellow brethren.
column4:
What about my forty
acres and a chocobo?
   - Imme

column2: Summon forth your sanuwa, specially bred and trained for riding by Gundu merchant Luna Vanu.
column3: Countless turns of the sun did Luna Vanu train this wild sanuwa to obey the orders of man, and for many moons did he wait for one he deemed worthy of taking up this noble cloudkin's reins. Wait, he did, until you arrived.
column4:
Wild sanuwa fierce
as monsoon rains.
   - Gunu Vanu

column2: Summon forth your griffin─half eagle, half lion, all business.
column3:
Fantastical winged beasts native to the unscalable peaks of Abalathia's Spine, griffins actually have a long history of serving as mounts. Indeed, before the city–state's fall, the Ala Mhigan army maintained a regiment of griffin–back
soldiers who would
harry opposing forces.
column4:
“Spread your wings and soar”
   - Highwind Skyways Slogan

column2: Call into battle your manacutter, a single-rider airship constructed at the Garlond Ironworks.
column3: Supervised (in spirit) by the ever-absent Cid, Biggs and Wedge (with a little bending over by Biggs) put their heads together to create this flight-ready miniature airship, powered by the realm's first corrupted crystal engine.
column4:
There are more of these
“manacutters” to be had,
yes?
   - Aymeric

column2: Summon forth your war panther─a silent killer trained to maim anyone and everything...excepting you, of course.
column3:
While more difficult to train than their cousins the coeurls, panthers bring their riders much more advantage on the field due to the beasts' inherent affinity to various magic. It is also believed that many dark knight battle techniques
were conceived by
watching panthers hunt.
column4:
I have seen you
move like a shadow.
   - Daimbert

column2: Call into battle your gobwalker, a steam-powered war vehicle designed by the infamous Illuminati.
column3: Originally designed to be a less-fickle replacement for pack raptors, the gobwalker was quickly reoutfitted into a tool of war after it took twenty goblins to chase down and topple a walker that had gone out of control and destroyed an entire workshop.
column4:
Ye would have more luck
findin'...well, a gobmachine
bangplate on a tree!
   - Papana

column2: Summon forth Twintania, an ancient wyvern who secretly dreams of freedom...and devouring you.
column3: Bound to eternal thralldom via an Allagan neurolink, this ancient wyvern from the southern continent of Meracydia will remain a loyal servant as long as you possess its identification key.
column4:
There are wyverns.
Wyverns everywhere.
   - Vath Drone

column2: Summon forth your witch's broom. Here is to hoping it refrains from “flipping you over, flip flip” while flying.
column3: Once an ordinary household cleaning tool, relegated to such menial tasks as sweeping and...sweeping, this broom's life changed upon being enchanted by the ogre pumpkinhead. Now the skies are its dusty floors.
column4:
Are you going to introduce
yourself to that broom or not?
   - Matoya

column2: Summon forth a pegasus─winged white horse of legend.
column3: While rumors of a winged horse have graced ancient tomes for centuries, until recently, very little in the way of proof of their existence remained save the random feather or horseshoe housed in some remote monastery's reliquary.
column4:
Sprout wings, I will!
   - You

column2: Call into battle the White Devil─Livia sas Junius's custom-made battle armor, now <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> custom-made battle armor.
column3: This masterpiece of imperial ingenuity is the selfsame suit of warmachina operated by XIVth Legion tribunus Livia sas Junius in the Garlean Empire's subjugation of Othard's southern reaches.
column4:
Ever the pessimist,
my dear Livia.
   - Nero tol Scaeva

column2: Call into battle the Red Baron─Nero tol Scaeva's custom-made battle armor, now <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> custom-made battle armor.
column3: Constantly modified and improved by Nero himself, this warmachina of Garlean construct barely resembles the suit issued to tol Scaeva on the day of his promotion to tribunus.
column4:
That mechanical monstrosity represented
a feat of engineering far beyond aught
Garlemald can presently achieve.
   - Cid

column2: Summon forth your wyvern, master of the skies and forever-loyal servant.
column3: Fifty score years ago, this wyvern made a pact with a knight to aid in vanquishing evil from the skies. Even now, long after the knight's passing, the wyvern has kept that promise, ever circling the heavens─ignoring the calls of his brethren to take up arms against mankind.
column4:
A wyvern... I'd only ever
heard stories about them.
   - Saintrelmaux

column2: Call into battle the SDS Fenrir, a lore-bending battlebike that looks as if it was driven straight from an age unknown.
column3: Manufactured for use by the now-defunct Strife Delivery Service, this two-wheeled monstrosity's ceruleum engine howls like the silver wolf of legend as it propels its rider across desert and plain.
column4:
Misfortune is no excuse
for failing a delivery!
   - Hildeyerd

column2: Summon forth your kongamato, raised with care by the Vath stickpeddler.
column3: After hatching from an egg laid near the riverbanks, the kongamato larva spends its early life as a water-dwelling insect. Its maturity is signified by metamorphosis, during which its wings sprout forth and it takes to the skies.
column4:
Kongamato can be fickle─yes,
very fickle─but they always
return home to us.
    - Vath Kintamer

column2: Summon forth your zu. Its weighty wings have carried it from the Near East.
column3: This massive bird hunts by grasping its prey within its saw-like beak, and finishes it off with a few violent shakes of its long neck before swallowing the now-dead quarry whole.
column4:
Could you imagine how noisy
it'd be with even more
anzu flying around, kupo?
    - Mogoon

column2: Summon forth the mythical bennu. Very few have had the privilege of viewing this bird up close.
column3: This bird was reborn after drinking deep of the aether that flowed forth from the immortal Phoenix, who appeared in the skies of Carteneau during the Calamity. Named after a legendary bird, bennu means “a shining object, rising in brilliance.”
column4:
'Twixt this world and the next
do the aetherial currents swirl,
bearing the very essence of life.
    - Urianger

column2: Summon forth the white lanner. Favored of the primal Bismarck, he soars the skies unchallenged.
column3:
These birds are clad in roiling clouds, and noble Vanu Vanu warriors would sit astride them as part of Bismarck's retinue. The grace with which they glide through the skies evokes the image of a
flower petal being carried
by gentle western winds.
column4:
From what we have observed,
Bismarck is a creature of pure
instinct, driven primarily by hunger.
    - Cid

column2: Summon forth the rose lanner. Favored of the primal Ravana, his wings pierce the night sky like a blade of moonlight.
column3:
The ferocity of these birds is enough to give pause to the bravest warrior, and their keen talons cut through flesh as cleanly the Chandrahas themselves. Any who endeavor to mount the rose lanner must possess the savagery that defines the
Wrath of the Colony.
column4:
Master of the Sacred Blades!
Wrath of the Colony! Conqueror
of the World! Hear our prayer!
    - Gnath Priest

column2: Summon forth the round lanner. Favored of the primal King Thordan, he serves his master's knights dutifully.
column3:
These birds are possessed of dignity equal to the noble personages whom they serve. Ancient Ishgardian knights often indulged themselves in falconry, and lanners were revered for their abilities, their lyncean eyes being
well suited for sighting
prey on the ground.
column4:
For the glory of King Thordan...
    - Zephirin

column2: Summon forth the warring lanner. Favored of the primal Sephirot, it carries the seeds of the World Tree.
column3:
These birds are enveloped in an aura radiating a majesty that belies the savage nature of their master. According to the ancient legends of a treelike people native to Meracydia, the lanners bore the seeds of the
World Tree across the seas, planting
the verdant forests that
dot the realm today.
column4:
The trunk of the World Tree, or
the Bole, offers protection to the
weak, defending them from harm.
    - Mace

column2: Summon forth the Gloria-class airship. This single-occupancy airship is a singular feat of engineering.
column3:
Taking inspiration from the half-remembered dream of his grandfather Tatanora, Tataramu used his encyclopedic knowledge to design a small-scale version of a rotary-winged airship. Its name derives from an airship that appears
in an obscure novel of
unknown origins.
column4:
No, it must be one made to
extremely exacting specifications.
    - Tataramu

column2: Summon forth the flying cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey.
column3: There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds, the cumulus allows a single rider to explore the skies...but only if she has an inherent affinity for magicks.
column4:
Mental note: pick no
quarrel with Domans.
    - Thancred

column2: Summon forth the original fat chocobo. Of course, being the original, it can eat much more than its peers.
column3:
Maybe not larger, but definitely more in charge, this most gluttonous of gluttons inspired the others to great weights. Although most modern chocobos have yellow plumage, historic tomes portray birds covered
in feathers whiter than the whitest
snowfall─ All the better to see
the stains of its many meals.
column4:
Heave...heave...huff...huff... 
   - Original Fat Chocobo

column2: Summon forth Astrope. A fully grown pegasus large enough to bear you and a companion across gentle skies.
column3:
The emergent studies of winged horses had to be rewritten with a single sighting of Astrope, confirming that adult pegasi are not only enormous in size, but also possessed of a horn. Wary of most, Astrope only allows those of gentle heart to
climb upon its back─a back
large enough to seat two!
column4:
Spread our wings and
soar, we shall!
   - Sezul Totoloc

column2: Summon forth the fat moogle. How can he fly? Because magic. How can he fly bearing two riders? MAGIC.
column3:
This plus-sized patrician epitomizes the ancient moogle proverb regarding kupo nuts that says, “Once you kupop, you cannot stop.” Basic laws of physics suggest that wings as small as the fat moogle's should not provide enough lift for true flight...
yet here we are.
column4:
Yet what was thin must
eventually grow fat again.
   - Aurelle

column2: Summon forth a cloud mallow. It will carry you wherever the wind blows. Or, wherever you steer it.
column3:
While cloud mallows grow naturally in the Churning Mists, some of the inhabitants of Moghome have spent generations cultivating their own seeds to allow for stronger stems and larger yields of mallow puffs, a sprinkling of which can stimulate even the most lethargic of moogles
to work with unbridled joy.
column4:
Without my cloud mallows,
I can't do anything, kupopo!
   - Moggzia

column2: Summon forth the Whisper-go. A small, flying vessel designed in the likeness of a Yo-kai named Whisper.
column3: Taken in by the vibrant sights of the Gold Saucer, the wandering executive sought out the plaza's architect to design him a vessel of transportation similar in flamboyance to its myriad attractions. The seats are so finely upholstered riders swear it is as if they are floating on air.
column4:
So this is how
man flies without
wings? But it is
so strange-looking!
   - Dragonet

column2: Summon forth the dark lanner. Favored of Nidhogg, it fearlessly soars the skies of the Churning Mists.
column3:
Consumed by malice, these birds roost in Nidhogg's lair, and regularly bathe themselves in the aetheric tempests surrounding the Aery. Sight of their glowing wings outside the Churning Mists can set the common
folk into a panic, as they are
thought to be the Horde's
harbingers of death.
column4:
The minions of Nidhogg shall
not lightly suffer your presence
on that sacred mount.
   - Vidofnir

column2: Summon forth your aerodynamics system─marvel of ancient Allagan ingenuity.
column3:
Unearthed in the eastern lowlands of Coerthas, engineers surmise that this particular Allagan drone would likely have been used in aerial defense, although its weaponry functions are now beyond repair. Even so, it is still quite convenient
as a transportation device.
column4:
This node turned out to
be rather more useful than
I expected!
   - Cid

column2: Summon forth your disembodied head. Not <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> disembodied head. <Emphasis>A</Emphasis> disembodied head. That's yours.
column3:
E-Una-Kotor created this winged monstrosity using stone hewn from the very walls of the Palace of the Dead in an attempt to better understand the guardian golems which watch over the Lost City of Amdapor. That the face chosen for the design bears an uncanny likeness to a certain someone is one
stone best left unturned.
column4:
Unggghhh, my head...
   - Lewenhart

column2: Summon forth Managarm, a legendary hound said to dwell in the hidden depths of Abalathia's Spine.
column3: Some say that Managarm is merely a myth. Others believe it to be an extinct beast. Both are wrong, as you well know. According to Abalathian legend, this fearsome hound roams the celestial sphere in pursuit of the moon, whose light it relishes─or so it may appear to those who witness it soaring the skies, spawning spectral flames.
column4:
I should have been
the one to feed your
dark hound with light!
   - From an Ancient Epic

column2: Summon forth the Whisper A-go-go. A flashy upgrade to a small flying vessel designed in the likeness of a Yo-kai named Whisper.
column3: Moved by your unyielding dedication and patronage, the wandering executive once again commissioned the architects of the Gold Saucer, this time to upgrade the Whisper-go as a gift from himself and his friend, the wandering minstrel.
column4:
Ye gads! What was that
flash from the heavens?
It nearly blinded me!
   - Gilgamesh

column2: Summon forth Goten. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “roaring heavens.”
column3: This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate gold plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle.
column4:
The horse is merciful
and generous in victory.
   - Golden Uma Doshin

column2: Summon forth Ginga. A man-made aberration from a land that exists only in whispers. Its name is said to mean “silver fang.”
column3: This otherworldly mount, cobbled together from the carcasses of noble beasts and armored in elaborate silver plate, is said only to accept as riders those who have proven their might and mettle on the fields of battle.
column4:
Be as the horse, and leave
behind all doubts and bafflement!
   - Black Uma Doshin

column2: Summon forth your mystic panda. From Doma. From a thousand years ago.
column3:
Armed with the unexplainable ability to levitate...and little else, this thousand-year-old creature (age unconfirmed) has descended the ancient peaks of the Othardian Fanged Crescent in search of a hero to help
Doma wrench free from
the iron clutches of the
Garlean Empire.
column4:
Used to be prime huntin' grounds...
that is, till the bears moved in.
   - Tailfeather Hunter

column2: Summon forth your Sophic lanner. A once faithful servant to a fickle goddess.
column3:
History tells us that disruption in balance 'twixt good and evil will invariably result in suffering. The noble lanner serves to restore that balance by placing upon the goddess Sophia's scales the weights of equilibrium─
most commonly depicted
as our heroes of legend.
column4:
“A heartbeat without harmony
Is moonlight without dark.”
   - From <Emphasis>The Sophic Canticles</Emphasis>

column2: Summon forth your Starlight bear, and delight the younglings to no end.
column3: Unlike his wild cousins, <Switch(PlayerParameter(71))><Case(1)>Kochab</Case><Case(2)><If(PlayerParameter(4))>Kochab<Else/>Polaris</If></Case><Case(3)>Pferkad</Case><Case(4)>Kochab</Case><Case(5)>Polaris</Case><Case(6)><If(PlayerParameter(4))>Kochab<Else/>Polaris</If></Case><Case(7)>Polaris</Case><Case(8)>Kochab</Case></Switch> the bear can be relied upon to delight folk rather than tear them apart. Raised from a cub by Celebrant Baenfaeld, he has mastered the art of Starburst-lobbing, a skill that proved useful in hunting down thieving treants.
column4:
I never knew bears
could be so adorable!
   - Festival-goer

column2: Summon forth a black pegasus─winged horse of legend and bringer of death.
column3:
While uncommon, tales of pegasi black as ink can be found amongst the folklore of countless tribes. One similarity, however, can be observed in nearly all the renditions─that those unworthy of the steed will
have their very life essence
sapped the moment they
climb upon its back.
column4:
What is this malaise
which plagues me?
   - Beatin

column2: Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus. Arrhidaeus, Arrhidaeus. Oh, oh, oh, Arrhidaeus. Summon forth your Arrhidaeus.
column3:
Fabricated within Alexander's internal manufactories, Arrhidaeus was primarily used to wreak temporal disruption on any and all invaders. This particular construct saw its weapons systems overridden following capture, and now
serves as a glorified
transport module.
column4:
You are implying that
the Illuminati are aware
of this temporal disruption?
   - Mide

column2: Summon forth Raigo. Whether or not he heeds the call depends entirely on the number of bloodied laurels in your crown.
column3: The most daunting of Mado horses, Raigo eclipses its unholy brethren Goten and Ginga in both size and ferocity. As such, the creature will not suffer the burden of carrying a soul unbloodied, and therefore unworthy.
column4:
Your inner horse,
my dear adventurer,
must be a steed of rare beauty.
   - Golden Uma Yoriki

column2: Call into battle the Red Baron─Nero tol Scaeva's custom-made battle armor, now <Emphasis>your</Emphasis> custom-made battle armor.
column3: Constantly modified and improved by Nero himself, this warmachina of Garlean construct barely resembles the suit issued to tol Scaeva on the day of his promotion to tribunus.
column4:
That mechanical monstrosity represented
a feat of engineering far beyond aught
Garlemald can presently achieve.
   - Cid

column2: Summon forth your Demonic lanner─a symbol of justice for the Zurvan-worshipping races which once thrived on the southern continent of Meracydia.
column3: The centaurs of ancient Meracydia believed that their mighty god Zurvan would send out his lanner before a battle to inform his enemies of their impending defeat.
column4:
Watched me like a
bloody hawk, he did.
   - Austere Adventurer

column2: Summon forth your Firebird. Not Phoenix. Definitely not Phoenix.
column3: The Far East is home to numerous legends concerning birds of flame who sacrifice their lives to save the world, only to rise from the ashes of destruction to rule the skies once again. The Firebird is one of those legends...made a mount.
column4:
I was hoping for a fine bird.
   - Grimold

column2: Call into battle your eggshilaration system. Egg puns required for propulsion.
column3: After learning of the latest of the Dreamer's visions─a giant floating ovoid delivering eggs to all the good boys and girls of the realm─Nonotta and friends literally scrambled to find a means of bringing her dream to life. All it required was a little aid from the Sons of Saint Coinach...and the remnants of some ancient Allagan technology.
column4:
Why do the Qiqirn suck eggs?
   - Ba Go

column2: Summon forth your lone hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.
column3: Having survived, alone, the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon suffer the presence of others, choosing typically to attack before he himself becomes a victim. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on his back.
column4:
What in the seven unholy hells
are those gruesome things!?
   - Laraina

column2: Summon forth your pack hellhound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.
column3: Having commanded armies in the hellish darkness that is the void, this demonic beast will not soon submit at the feet of another. Which is why it is all the more surprising that the hound would allow someone on her back.
column4:
A good hound keeps
her maw shut.
   - Latata

column2: Summon forth your Archon throne. Don't call it a high chair.
column3: Despite claims that it was once the chair of Louisoix Leveilleur, former residents of Sharlayan have confirmed that it is naught more than an ordinary furnishing enchanted by a Great Gubal Library bibliophile who was tired of not being able to reach the upper shelves.
column4:
There's a chair over there
just cryin' out to be sat on.
   - Baderon

column2: Summon forth Syldra. Even in death, she would want to help.
column3:
Legends say there once lived a kindly sea dragon who befriended a pirate, and that their friendship knew no bounds. This is not that sea dragon; however, with a little time and caring, who is to say that a similar relationship cannot be forged?
※Sea dragons have no
relation to actual dragons.
column4:
I said, get off!
   - Faris

column2: Call into battle the <Emphasis>Falcon</Emphasis>, (unofficially) the fastest single-rider airship ever built in Eorzea.
column3: An independent project of Garlond Ironworks engineer Wedge, this single-rider airship allegedly recorded some of the fastest flight speeds ever...until a tragic accident following an attempt to see how high the ship could soar convinced its creator that perhaps a modicum of restraint was necessary.
column4:
All you have to do
is follow the falcon.
He knows where to go.
   - Baurendouin de Haillenarte

column2: Summon forth your lone faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.
column3: Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for he is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, his heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime hunting alone.
column4:
Dogs is loyal.
   - Latata

column2: Summon forth your pack faehound, void-spawned aberration loyal to none save you and yours.
column3: Covered from muzzle to tail in an otherworldly silver coat, the faehound appears more akin to something out of a faerie tale than from the nether-reaches of the void. Yet do not be fooled by the beast's appearance, for she is an equal in strength to all but the highest ranking voidsent, her heart swollen with savagery from a lifetime leading a pack of her own.
column4:
Are you inclined to
think them faerie tales?
   - Alberic

column2: Summon forth your blissful kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics.
column3: Believe it or not, this monstrous canine did not always glow, only achieving its heavenly effulgence upon receiving the blessing of Lakshmi after being offered to the Lady of Bliss by her loyal Ananta dreamers.
column4:
This is no lone
coywolf you'll be facing.
   - Hetzkin

column2: Summon forth your reveling kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics.
column3: Upon receiving from his Kojin worshipers the offering of a sad, orphaned wolf pup, Susano proceeded to grant him the gift of flight, as well as an impressive coat of glowing fur, that he might be worthy of the revel.
column4:
I ain't got words to mince with
whelps...unless that is, you're
here to become a wolf.
   - Curious Gorge

column2: Call into battle your magitek predator, and have you some fun.
column3: Predator series warmachina were originally designed in an attempt to improve magitek reaper killing potential via the addition of close-quarter weaponry. While the extra firepower led to a higher kill ratio, the weight it added severely hampered maneuverability. This unique model, however, appears to have had its weapons removed and replaced with an experimental propulsion engine.
column4:
I ain't got time to bleed.
   - Ancient Adage

column2: Summon forth your battle lion, fully armored to protect the majestic beast from the dangers of close combat.
column3: There was a time when members of Ul'dah's elite Sultansworn strode the Steps of Nald and Thal atop silver-plated lions, striking fear and awe into the mewling masses. An effort to return to those days of glory has seen the summoning of several of Thavnair's most prominent beast tamers to the Rose of the Desert.
column4:
Bright as a lamp,
brave as a lion.
   - Haermaga

column2: Summon forth your battle bear, fully armored to protect the savage beast from singeing its lustrous fur on the smoldering carnage left in its wake.
column3: The bears of Abalathia's Spine are not known to suffer the presence of man in their territory, let alone allow one to mount their backs and command them hither and yon. Then what, pray tell, has come over this particular specimen? Perhaps one look into your inner beast convinced the creature that submission spelled survival.
column4:
We're after a bear this time!?
Oh boy, this should be fun!
   - Enion

column2: Summon forth your battle panther, fully armored to protect the stealthy beast from the occasional poison dart, poison arrow, poison-tipped spear, poison spell, and any poison words directed its way.
column3: History tells us that no dark hero's story is complete without the companionship of a wily panther. Their sable coat, their savage nature, their attunement with the umbral, their thirst for blood. It is as if the gods created these creatures in the image of a dark knight...or perhaps it was the other way around.
column4:
If you help me out, I will
tell you more about my
feline friend here.
   - Hinoshin

column2: Summon forth your yol, proof of your recognition by the Azim Steppe Xaela as a true warrior.
column3: High atop the granite peaks of Othard's Fanged Crescent do the yol claim their demesne, descending to the Azim Steppe to prey upon the soft warriors who pretend not to fear the winged monsters of their ancestor's tales. Rare indeed is it that a yol might cede its back to the likes of man, though to those who have proved their mettle, the creatures have been known to make exception.
column4:
I must have faith in
myself and my yol...
   - Zealous Mol Warrior

column2: Summon forth Alte Roite, fantastical ur-being generated by Omega within the Deltascape.
column3: While none can be certain the exact intentions of a self-aware interdimensional construct, logic suggests this winged aberration is a reimagination of Alte Roite─a legendary wizard who is said could take the shape of a dragon at will.
column4:
That knowledge is my ticket
straight to glory. I can't go
telling any old person about it.
   - Bonifoix

column2: Summon forth your Centurio tiger, one mark the Clan actually does not want seen slain.
column3: In a rare display of misguided compassion, a member of Clan Centurio returned from a Hunt with the whimpering cub of a slain S-rank mark. Unable to grant it the mercy it so deserved, the veteran took to caring for the beast until his deceit was discovered and his membership revoked. However, by then, not a single other member could bring themselves to harm the pet they had all come to love.
column4:
This game of cat and mouse
continued for what seemed
an eternity.
   - Alberic

column2: Summon forth mighty Ixion, legend of the Gyr Abanian highlands.
column3: Ask any Gyr Abanian youth, and she will tell you the story of Ixion, Rhalgr's magnificent steed─swift as a levinbolt and strong as thunderclap. However, the recent discovery of several ancient Mhachi texts suggests that the creature may simply be a stallion augmented by ancient technologies that have granted Ixion life eternal...and the ability to shoot lightning from its eyes.
column4:
He said what?
“Horses are that strong”?
   - Red Uma Doshin

column2: Summon forth the legendary kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics.
column3: Perpetually enveloped in a divine glow, it is said to have been born when an Ala Mhigan war hound chanced to bathe in Shinryu's light in the moment of the primal's birth.
column4:
It is a delicate dance...
and one which asks
much of my hounds.
   - Zenos yae Galvus

column2: Summon forth your Nezha chariot and travel the skies like a god.
column3: Yanxian legend tells of a chariot that would carry gods and heroes across the heavens that they might keep watch over their earthbound children. Surprisingly, the realm's flora and fauna are unscathed by the fire and wind belched forth by the divine carriage.
column4:
You look to me like
a <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If> in need of a nice,
relaxin' carriage ride!
   - Bremondt

column2: Summon forth your striped ray, a majestic creature native to the Ruby Sea.
column3: Raised and trained by the Kojin, this striped ray has the same mellow temperament as its original masters. Its flat body works in like fashion to the aether-imbued wings of an airship, allowing it to catch water- and wind-aspected aether to glide through both sea and sky with ease.
column4:
I advise you to
stand back when he
regurgitates everything.
   - Zukin

column2: Summon forth your Aquamarine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of aquamarine geometry.
column3: Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large aquamarine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.
column4:
What have we here?
An admirer of the arcane?
A connoisseur of Carbuncles?
   - Ulan

column2: Summon forth your Citrine Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of citrine geometry.
column3: Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large citrine, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.
column4:
My, what a splendid
thing you are.
   - Ulan

column2: Summon forth a flying chair to bear you in high style.
column3: Featuring elegant lines and designed to minimize waste, this lovingly crafted chair is bound to fly into the hearts of adventurers the world over. No assembly required.
column4: Maximum load: 240 pz.

column2: Call into battle your magitek avenger, an imperial warmachina made mightier by goblin hands.
column3: The goblins have carried out extensive work on this magitek avenger, among other things changing it from an autonomous killing machine to one requiring a pilot. After all, there's no substituting the satisfaction of dealing vengeance with one's own hands. Sort of.
column4:
Pshkohhh! Revenge!
   - Moundrinx Eightclinks

column2: Summon forth your korpokkur kolossus, a veritable colossus among its kind.
column3: In search of an ideal home, this korpokkur journeyed long malms before finally coming to a stop at the Gold Saucer. The trek across the scorching Sagolii had reduced it to a withered husk, but when next it drank, it experienced what could only be described as an epic rebound.
column4:
What have you been
feeding this thing?
   - Forward Maiden

column2: Summon forth the Red Hare─legendary steed known for both its unmatchable speed and its fiery red coat.
column3: Ganen was known for his imposing presence on the battlefield, a trait that can partially be attributed to his mount, the Red Hare─a lightning-swift steed magicked to stride the very heavens. This horse is said to be a direct descendant of the awe-inspiring stallion. Probably.
column4:
...I spring across the
battlefield with the
swiftness of the rabbit!
   - Gyosei

column2: Summon forth the auspicious kamuy, blessed wolf who shall not be bound by such corporeal laws as gravity or aerodynamics.
column3: Said to be swaddled in the very winds of heaven, this majestic creature was once a brutal killer of man. A chance meeting with auspice lord Byakko, however, saw the bloodlust in its heart fade.
column4:
I did not anticipate
the arrival of that
fearsome hound.
   - X'rhun Tia

column2: Call into battle your magitek death claw, an imperial warmachina based on ancient Allagan technology.
column3:
Ancient Allagan weaponry known as an “iron claw” is believed to be the inspiration for this deadly example of imperial ingenuity. While most of the death claws deployed in battle are used for logistical purposes, this particular model has been
customized by stationarii
units for enemy capture.
column4:
Only so many of us find
machina pretty, my dear.
   - Mide

column2: Summon forth your marid, trained by the Ananta and outfitted with a magicked carpet allowing for flight.
column3: There was once a time when if someone told you they witnessed a marid aloft, you could have had them committed to a sanatorium. Now, marids crisscross the skies thanks, in part, to magicked carpets which the Ananta affix to the backs of beasts they train for battle.
column4:
A rampaging marid is
absolutely unssstoppable.
   - Dakshina

column2: Summon forth your true griffin, a noble winged beast native to the hidden reaches of Abalathia's Spine.
column3: Covered in the pristine white feathers representative of a true griffin, this native of Abalathia's Spine has been trained by Giff, one of the Ala Mhigan Resistance's most competent handlers. So tame is the creature that it will even emit powerful bursts of air on command.
column4:
Their meat's supposed to be
some of the best around.
   - Papin

column2: Summon forth your tyrannosaur and experience firsthand a lost time when scalekin ruled the world.
column3:
Alarmed scholars report that the “T-Rex”—as it is called by those short on ink—has gained the power of flight through continued exposure to the Isle of Val's turbulent aether. Despite its ferocious nature, some still approach it, insisting it can be tamed by an adventurer of great
strength.
column4:
The tyrannosaurs have
become pests as of late.
   - Vath Keeneye

column2: Summon forth your Regalia Type-G, ceruleum-powered magitek transportation vehicle crafted by Garlond Ironworks.
column3: To hear Cid tell it, equal parts elbow grease and gumption were all that was required to see the Type-G (for “Garlond”) fully operational...when, in all truth, the otherworldly carriage most likely required an amazing amount of reverse engineering to recreate.
column4:
Do they truly believe it makes them
look more imposing? Or are they
merely compensating for something?
   - Lalai

column2: Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the right half of a Valentione's Day heart.
column3: Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts.
column4:
But alas...the heart
will not be denied.
   - Byakudan

column2: Summon forth your broken heart─a magicked chair representing the left half of a Valentione's Day heart.
column3: Burdened with a warehouse of unsold broken heart chairs, House Valentione came up with the diabolic plan to repurpose the cushions with cloudsbreath and peddle them to the unknowing masses as flying mounts. Lady Lisette dreams of one day riding the hearts on her honeymoon.
column4:
But alas...the heart
will not be denied.
   - Byakudan

column2: Summon forth Typhon, hideous voidsent aberration and standout employee at the Manderville Gold Saucer.
column3: Since his summoning from the void by the Thaumaturges' Guild, Typhon has experienced his share of ups and downs. Through an employment opportunity at the Manderville Gold Saucer, however, the gaping-mawed horror─described by close acquaintances as quiet and reserved─has (figuratively speaking) landed back on his feet.
column4:
Is that your st-stomach
I hear rumbling?
   - Orthrus

column2: Call into battle Air Force, a flying weapon of masculine destruction somehow smuggled from Omega's Sigmascape.
column3: From the amount of ordinance equipped, one can gather that this oddly shaped airship was employed in battle. However, being from the Sigmascape, who employed it and when are anyone's guess. The shark maw painted on its bow suggests an underwater civilization.
column4:
Transforming the wonder of air travel
into a means for delivering death is
blasphemy of the highest order!
   - Tataramu

column2: Summon forth the lunar kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the Lady of the Moon.
column3: When a wild wolf living in an abandoned imperial stronghold is bathed in the aether of a goddess reborn, amazing results are to be expected.
column4:
Doth the sun,
in her midday glory,
outshine the moon
of a night silent and solitary?
   - Seigetsu the Enlightened

column2: Summon forth your noble dodo─hopefully not the last one in existence.
column3: For centuries people of the Far East believed the dodo lost─the cloudkin hunted to extinction by poachers who would use its feathers for petticoats and its eggs for cheesy omelettes. The recent discovery of a nest in the upper echelons of Heaven–on–High, however, has given naturalists hope that the species may still endure.
column4:
Those are some interestin'-lookin'
dodos ye've got there.
   - Jacke

column2: Summon forth a massive whale straight from the Indigo Deep. If only you could do this with fish as well.
column3: Pods of these massive wavekin are believed to traverse the Indigo Deep for thousands of malms in pursuit of food. Why they would choose to limit themselves to the confines of the sea despite possessing the capacity for aether-assisted flight is a mystery scholars have pondered for centuries.
column4:
Why, what a whale you've
whisked out of the whitecaps!
   - Wawalago

column2: Summon forth your mighty Rathalos─a wyvern far, far from home.
column3: Many a brave hunter has attempted to topple this flame-belching beast from his fiery throne atop the forest, yet only a few can claim to have conquered the King of the Skies.
column4:
The wyverns are scary.
Is there no safe place?
   - Wandering Gnath

column2: Call into battle your magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.
column3: It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so for the past twenty summers, imperial magitek engineers have been perfecting the art of aerial transport. Surprisingly, it is not outfitted with an active weapons system─clearly an oversight that will be amended in the next model.
column4:
I cannot begin to comprehend
what our visitor is trying to
convey.
   - OIC Administrator

column2: Call into battle your prototype magitek conveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.
column3: It is not in Garlean nature to leave well enough alone, and so, not a single moon after the completion of their new conveyor system, imperial magitek engineers returned to the drawing board to improve upon their creation─replacing existing steel exoplates with <Emphasis>high-quality</Emphasis> steel exoplates.
column4:
You are not <Emphasis>supposed</Emphasis>
to be able to descend
of your own volition.
   - Nero tol Scaeva

column2: Summon your team of Namazu bearers, carrying a garish mikoshi upon which to precariously perch as they waddle to your destination.
column3: Due to excessive zeal on the part of Gyoshin, this mikoshi was crafted with more cloudsbreath than is necessary or, indeed, safe. Thus, it not only floats atop the shoulders of its bearers, it soars aloft regardless of their presence─though that does not discourage them from clinging to its poles anyway.
column4:
Wasshoi! Wasshoi! Wassh─ Ow!
I think I pulled something...
   - Gyoshin

column2: Summon Juedi, and jump straight to ludicrous speed.
column3: Its ancient Doman name loosely translating to “ludicrously swift steed that runs so fast its feet no longer touch the ground,” Juedi is yet another horse of legend, showered with geomantic magicks to grant the creature the gift of flight.
column4:
How mightily <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> must have
toiled to <Emphasis>become</Emphasis> a horse...
   - Haurchefant

column2: Call into battle your Allagan safeguard system. For your safety and the safety of those around you, all weaponry has been disabled.
column3: One of the automated system drones deployed by the Allagans to maintain and protect their strongholds. After being unearthed by the Sons of Saint Coinach, the mechanical sphere's processing unit was updated with the aid of Garlond Ironworks engineers to improve security.
column4:
The system crashes...
   - Ardashir

column2: Summon Grani, heroic steed from a realm not your own.
column3: Possessed of a strength of both mind and body that is unmatched in the First, as a mount, Grani has no peer on land nor in the heavens. It is said, however, the noble creature will only accept a rider who has pledged to restore shadow to a land bereft of night.
column4:
The lives of my men may depend
upon the swiftness of your steed...
   - Topher

column2: Summon your fatter cat─fatter than a fat cat, obviously.
column3: Seeing as how this pursy pussy can defy the very laws of physics by propelling itself high into the firmament, it is very likely that the creature is either a voidsent using a bloated cat's corpse as its corporeal vessel, or a deceased pet reanimated by one well versed in the necromantic arts.
column4:
The entire city would be overrun
with large-testicled raccoon
dogs and flying rainbow cats...
   - Kyokuho

column2: Summon your euphonious kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the scarlet auspice Suzaku.
column3: Having sacrificed its life to save his master, this magnificent canine was spared the pull of the Lifestream by the auspice Suzaku and her scarlet flames of rebirth.
column4:
Yes, yes, that's the
spirit, little wolves...
   - Disembodied Voice

column2: Call into battle your Model O, autonomous aerial transport device constructed in Omega's interdimensional manufactory.
column3: Though it is difficult to fathom why Omega would require a weaponless flying mount designed to comfortably accommodate a denizen of Hydaelyn, Garlond Ironworks engineers posit the construct was fabricated in an attempt to better understand its enemies.
column4:
'Tis one of Omega's creations.
   - Midgardsormr

column2: Call into battle your magitek sky armor, state-of-the-art Garlean flight technology at an affordable price.
column3: After engine failure saw this single-seated warmachina abandoned on the field of battle, it was salvaged by members of the Eorzean Alliance who had the device sent to the Garlond Ironworks for research and repair.
column4:
MuSt... ReTrIeVe... ArMoR...
   - Tsukumo

column2: Summon forth your magicked carpet. Fantasy will set you free. Finally.
column3: It is said an ancient king of Corvos, upon conquering a tribe of faeries, bid the faerie queen weave her magicks to forge an object the likes mankind had never seen. The queen was executed shortly after presenting the king with a flying carpet. This is not <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> carpet, but at least no one was slain in its creation.
column4:
Just be careful not to spill
any beverages on the carpets.
   - Choir Moogle

column2: Call into battle your magna roader and try not to think too hard on why it is called such.
column3: Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania, several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to refurbish the damaged warmachina. The auto-pilot systems, however, were beyond repair, so the engineers were forced to compromise by adding a mannable cockpit.
column4:
We have a long
road ahead of us.
   - Mogzin

column2: Summon forth your fat black chocobo and marvel at its flurry of pitch-dark plumage.
column3: According to those familiar with this prodigious poultry's journey from flightless fledgling to full-blown fowl, the cloudkin achieved its staggering girth after several summers of gluttonously gulping chunks of charred chicken. Though, many speculate that the chocobo is, in fact, no chocobo at all, but a heretofore unseen spirit (or demon) of Dravania's dark wood.
column4:
Black winds bring terrible news!
   - Linu Vali

column2: Summon forth your Eldthurs, named for a fiery giant who once ruled a realm of flame with his brothers.
column3: Despite the imposing name, naturalists believe Eldthursar to be naught but yeti whose ancestors forswore their icy mountain homes, choosing instead the molten lakes of Pyros to raise their young. Though not necessarily known for their obedience, this particular specimen has been trained to accept the orders of a rider without taking a bite out of her thigh.
column4:
The giants were...
thorough in their work.
   - Alianne

column2: Call into battle your maxima roader─many times mightier than the mightiest of magna roaders.
column3: Following their discovery of an imperial roader abandoned in Gyr Abania, several clever goblins came up with the ingenious plan to not only refurbish the damaged warmachina, but to improve upon its design by adding cermet alloy exoplating and reorganizing synthetic musculature.
column4:
We've a bloody long
road ahead of us.
   - Mitsuba

column2: Summon forth Sabotender Emperador and bask in his desert sun radiance.
column3: No one knows exactly why the Manderville Gold Saucer was built to resemble a sabotender, just as no one knows why its mascot is a sabotender or why more than half of its drink menu features sabotender-themed “cact-tails.” This giant flying sabotender will not see you any closer to those answers, but it is fun to stare at.
column4:
Very fleet of foot,
those sabotenders.
   - Mayaru Moyaru

column2: Summon Kamuy of the Nine Tails, legendary auspice, completely independent from Kyubi of the Nine Tails.
column3: Only an individual who has proven his worth by taming no less than seven kamuy might summon this fabled vulpine auspice from her burrow in the heavens. Despite obvious similarities to the <Emphasis>other</Emphasis> vulpine auspice, Kyubi of the Nine Tails, this ageless vixen has her own storied history...which is, sadly, too long to list here.
column4:
Most revered among the
kamuy, Kyubi is come!
   - The Wandering Minstrel

column2: Summon your hallowed kamuy, noble wolf blessed by the azure auspice Seiryu.
column3: Abandoned by its master, this loyal canine was discovered by the auspice Seiryu and granted a new life in service of the thousand-year-old lord.
column4:
A wolf! Or at least someone
what's got big ears and a long
fluffy tail!
   - Nashu Mhakaracca

column2: Summon forth your war tiger to tear the enemy's morale to shreds with its cruel, curved fangs.
column3: Even among tigers, the sabertooth is said to be notoriously difficult to tame, but those creatures raised from birth may come to bear riders upon their backs and into war.
column4:
T-T-T-T-T-TIGERS!!!
- Hapless Namazu

column2: Summon your Eurekan petrel, because who hasn't dreamed of gazing down upon all creation from the mantle of a wind-borne gastropod?
column3: Of all the species of petrels known to man, the Eurekan petrel is the only one which is not actually a petrel, but, in fact, an oversized carnivorous sea slug. Admittedly, unlike most sea slugs, this unique variety possesses the capacity for extended flight, hence the understandable misnomer.
column4:
I know you love me,
little swallow, but sometimes
you just have to let go!
   - Karasu

column2: Call into battle your magitek avenger A-1─outfitted and optimized for alpine warfare.
column3: Proving once again there is naught a Garlean engineer can do that a goblin cannot do better, this magitek avenger, nicknamed the “Yeti,” has been repurposed with several layers of self-insulating exoplating, which draw on the ceruleum engine's residual heat to keep the rider warm even in the coldest of climes.
column4:
I'll avenge myself, kupo!
   - Pukla Puki

column2: Call into battle Demi-Ozma─the round mound of spellbound.
column3: After concluding that Ozma of the Weeping City was but a preliminary attempt to weave an aether-based simulacrum of the Eurekan phenomenon Proto Ozma, the Students of Baldesion endeavored to apply similar magicks in the creation of what they dubbed “Demi-Ozma,” hoping to learn what makes the entity tick.
column4:
Follow the sphere!
   - X'rhun Tia

column2: Summon forth your amaro, Norvrandt's favorite beast of burden.
column3:
Of all the mounts seen in Norvrandt, naught is more ubiquitous than the amaro. Originally created by the mages of ancient Ronka, who selectively bred the flightless cama, present-day beasts carry the seed of their ancestors, which may
manifest in the form of
superior intellect.
column4:
That ever-so-endearing “gwee!”
It's enough to melt a man's heart,
I tell you.
   - Lamlyn

column2: Summon forth your skyslipper, the greatest mechanical marvel to ever resemble a shoe.
column3:
Once belonging to the imperial family, this unique craft was abandoned in a grotto by its owners due to a malfunction. It was later retrieved via airship and stored in the Crystal Tower, where it lay until its recent rediscovery and restoration
by artisans of the
Crystalline Mean.
column4:
Ready to take us wherever
we need to go, aye. Back again
too, maybe, if we ask it nicely.
   - Thancred

column2: Summon forth your fae gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.
column3: Desiring to recreate the fantastical beast known as the dragon, a sorcerer from ages past fashioned a horn imbued with Titania's power. The creature which answers the sound is aglow with fae magicks.
column4:
Come to hear about
dragon legends, yes, yes?
   - Gyodo

column2: Summon forth your triceratops seemingly from a page right out of prehistory.
column3:
In defiance of its bulk, this prehistoric horned beast has been rendered capable of flight courtesy of its saddle. Employing Ronkan ingenuity, the singular contraption was modified from an artifact discovered within ancient ruins by the moogle Nutsy,
fearless leader of the clan
of his namesake.
column4:
Can you please go and steal
a dinosaur egg for us?
   - Vath Braveheart

column2: Summon forth your ironfrog mover, a dwarf-made automaton.
column3:
Dwarven artisans have reinforced this automaton to improve lower body durability as well as installed a propulsion unit to enable flight. The techniques employed in its creation are a jealously guarded secret, and a blight upon the beards
of they who betray it.
column4:
Lali-ho!
   - Every single dwarf

column2: Summon forth your innocent gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.
column3: Answering to a horn imbued with the almighty Innocence's power, this draconic arcane entity is enveloped in the selfsame glow as the Lightwarden whence it takes its name. Rest assured it is not a sin eater.
column4:
It would not do for an
unadorned winged lizard
to be the protagonist.
   - Alberic

column2: Summon forth your magicked bed, and dream a little dream of never needing to get up.
column3:
Once upon a time, in the Kingdom of Voeburt, there lived a member of the royal family slothful of body but quick of mind. This man desired naught more than to never be parted from his pillow, and so commissioned a bed that could fly...only to swiftly
take to the sky without paying for it.
He, presumably, lived happily ever after.
column4:
Do not your mortal bodies tire?
Far better to dwell in dream.
   - Sri Lakshmi

column2: Summon forth your Circus ahriman, a voidsent bred by the Continental Circus.
column3: Raised in hopes that its Dread Gaze would reap a bountiful harvest of terror, this ahriman proved a disappointment. It has since found a new calling as an adventurer's trusty mount.
column4:
You have the eye of
an ahriman, Yda.
   - Y'shtola

column2: Summon forth the sunspun cumulus. It is unclear whether its previous owner was a boy with a tail or simply a monkey.
column3:
There is but one man in all of Hydaelyn who can create such a mystical masterpiece, and it is said he resides upon a misty peak hidden within the mountain ranges of Doma. Crafted by stitching together dozens of smaller clouds dyed golden by the sun,
this cumulus is said to bring
good fortune to its rider.
column4:
If you live with your head
in the clouds, sooner or later
you'll find yourself on your rear.
   - Brangwine

column2: Summon forth your battle tiger, now with 100% more sharp things with which to terrorize your foes.
column3: In the region of Bozja in Ilsabard, the sabertooth tiger has long been employed in warfare as part of infantry. Many soldiers developed an enduring bond with the beasts, whom they would affectionately refer to as their “kittens.”
column4:
Tigers! And they
look hungry!
   - Hapless Namazu

column2: Summon forth your morbol. Strong vines, soft heart...middling stench.
column3: Though all it has ever wanted is to help, this morbol was found to be “too sweet” to present a challenge at the Celestium, and was transferred to the Blue Mages' Guild before it had even seen its first match─only for it to be deemed “insufficiently vile” there as well.
column4:
A morbol!? And things
were going so well...
   - Papalymo

column2: Summon forth your portly porxie. Bears you places to the tantalizing smell of cured meats.
column3:
A prodigious porxie created by the Nu Mou Lugg Aenc for transportation purposes. Fond of sausages, it oft spends its free time in the curing chamber, and thus has come to take on the aroma. While comfortable to
ride thanks to its soft curves,
expect regular rumblings
from its belly.
column4:
Oooh, when I get my hands
on those porxienappers...
   - Uin Nee

column2: Summon forth Epimetheus, an unstoppable vehicle of war. Or at least it would be if it were bigger.
column3: Garlond Ironworks recreated this warmachina from a blueprint acquired by a Scion operative on a covert mission to Garlemald. As the dimensions were missing from the document, however, its size had to be estimated, the resultant vehicle being rather smaller than the original.
column4:
I never dreamed that I would
have the chance to see such a
ferocious warmachina with my
own eyes!
   - Warmachina Fanatic

column2: Summon forth Menoetius. Just like Epimetheus, but more comfortable.
column3: Following their successful recreation of Epimetheus, Garlond Ironworks set out to refine the vehicle's design. Their efforts resulted in Menoetius, a model which retains its predecessor's speed while boasting improved comfort and manufacturability.
column4:
Of late, all I can think about is
Weapons, Weapons, Weapons.
   - Warmachina Fanatic

column2: Summon forth your Construct VII. Rumors that it is heavily based on an Ivalician design are entirely unfounded. Well, almost.
column3: Having taken prisoner what they thought was an automaton during a skirmish with the kobolds, Maelstrom officers were shocked to find that it was instead a type of synthetic golem─but not so shocked as to not immediately bring it to Naldiq & Vymelli's for repair and later sale.
column4:
So the kobolds are at it again...
   - Anaoc

column2: Summon forth your shadow gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.
column3: Answering to a horn imbued with the power of a sorcerer of eld, this draconic arcane entity is believed to have been created by Emet-Selch on a whim─an act that would have barely taxed his powers as an ancient.
column4:
Are you some kind of
lesser dragon, kupo?
   - Mogzin

column2: Summon forth your spriggan stonecarrier. Lives to carry ore, eggs, and you.
column3:
Grown to a prodigious size by virtue of its appetite, this spriggan was choking on a chunk of ore when it was found and saved by a band of miners. Seeking to repay the kindness of men, it took to carrying their burdens, which apparently
includes men themselves.
column4:
It must be so tiring living
each day carrying around
a brain of solid stone.
   - Da Za

column2: Summon forth your forgiven reticence. The strong and silent type, so don't expect rousing conversation.
column3: Alerted to its presence in the basement of Eulmore, the hunters of Clan Nutsy set out to vanquish this sin eater. Upon seeing that the creature was not aggressive, however, they decided to keep it instead.
column4:
Pray excuse our reticence.
   - Lucia

column2: Summon forth your dhalmel, a towering herbivore native to the Sea of Clouds.
column3:
While attempting to nibble at a tree on a nearby isle, this dhalmel lost its footing and fell. As it plunged towards certain death, the fervent desire to live awakened its latent ability to harness the wind, and thus did it soar to safety.
This may or may not have
happened, but let's say it did.
column4:
You've never <Emphasis>seen</Emphasis>
a dhalmel before!?
   - Atelloune

column2: Summon forth your albino karakul, a black sheep among its kind. Which is to say it's white.
column3:
Though karakuls ordinarily have black fleece, this creature raised in the paddocks of House Haillenarte was born snowy white. This rarest of qualities spared it a fate at the dining table, and it grew to such a size as to be able to bear people
upon its fluffy back.
column4:
A wise knight keeps her
own source of wool.
   - Yaelle

column2: Summon forth your ufiti. May carry you to high ground for your own safety.
column3:
Having survived a cull of its kind by bloodthirsty adventurers on its native Diadem, this ufiti mastered the art of riding the winds, that it might set forth on a journey to find a worthy leader. Despite its brawn, it possesses a surprisingly
delicate touch─and just
as well it does.
column4:
The strong are drawn to strength.
   - Ywain

column2: Summon forth your kingly peacock, an avian embodiment of nobility hailing from Othard.
column3:
From the Near East to the Far, the peacock has long been esteemed not only for its beauty, but also its penchant for eating harmful vilekin. This particular creature belongs to a breed created by improving a species indigenous to
Othard with geomancy.
column4:
Don't you be taken in
by his peacockin'.
   - Rowena

column2: Summon forth the Great Vessel of Ronka. Don't mind the contents.
column3:
This ancient Ronkan urn was discovered empty save for a peculiar flute, the sound of which caused the vessel to suddenly become thus occupied. “Where did it come from?” the curious may be compelled to inquire, but the wise know better
than to question the divine.
column4:
The great serpent
has spoken!
   - Quinfort

column2: Summon forth your pteranodon, a winged scalekin that has existed since ancient times.
column3: In the course of feeding upon food scraps discarded at the <Emphasis>Bounty</Emphasis>, this creature grew so familiar with men as to allow riders upon its back. This goes to show that the way to a prehistoric creature's heart is through its stomach.
column4:
With what powerful magicks
did they tame this dread fiend?
   - Nashu Mhakaracca

column2: Summon forth your ruby gwiber, a draconic arcane entity.
column3: Believed to have been absorbed into the Ruby Weapon, this plate-clad being answers the call of a horn imbued with the power of an unknown primal. How the secrets of the horn came to be passed on to its summoner remains a mystery.
column4:
A jeweler's daughter must be
refined─<Emphasis>resplendent</Emphasis>. A ruby
amongst the riffraff.
   - Babawai

column2: Summon forth your hybodus to ride the winds and menace the skies.
column3: A close relative of the tornado shark, this fearsome fish soars the skies by means of an organ that allows it to manipulate wind-aspected aether. The four fins protruding from its head are used to deftly control its course in flight.
column4:
What will the morrow bring?
Sharks spilling from the sky in a
spectacular shower of scales?
   - Sisipu

column2: Summon forth Ramuh. No, not that one. The one you fought in the Empty. But not the actual one.
column3:
It is believed that Shiva's summoning in the Empty caused lightning-aspected aether left over from your battle with Ramuh to coalesce. The resultant crystal, when imbued with magic, gives rise to an entity which assumes the form of
the Lord of Levin in all of his
horse-legged, hulking glory.
column4:
Now nature sends thunder
and lightning against us!
   - Sylphie

column2: Summon forth your Rubellite Carbuncle, an arcane entity given form by the mysteries of rubellite geometry.
column3: Those adventurers who have longed to hop on their Carbuncles' backs can give thanks to the arcanist Ulan, whose research into Diamond Carbuncle provided the necessary cues to create an arcane entity of ridable proportions. As its form is maintained by a large rubellite, it can be summoned even by those unversed in the ways of arcanima.
column4:
Betrayed by my own
carbuncle yet again...
   - Tataru

column2: Summon forth your chocobo carriage to ferry your friends around in comfort.
column3:
A ubiquitous mode of transportation in Eorzea, the chocobo carriage is kept aloft by ceruleum gas-filled bladders. This technology traces its origins to an early Ixali dirigible that crashed in the Twelveswood and was seized by Gridanian
authorities.
column4:
We get to ride a horsebird
carriage? I don't know...
It sounds scary.
   - Doman Child

column2: Summon forth your Rolling Tankard, a mighty warmachina built by the blacksmiths of Watts's Anvil.
column3:
Based on a concept by the legendary Watts, this dwarven warmachina is propelled by a nine-cylinder radial ethanol engine. Its turret-mounted crystal cannon makes short work of sin eaters, while its arms can perform essential motions
such as upending tankards.
column4:
The Rollin' Tankards,
at your service!
   - Ronitt

column2: Summon forth your gwiber of light, a draconic arcane entity.
column3:
This light-bathed being answers to the sound of a horn imbued with the power of a hero of eld. In another time and place, perhaps it was the mount of a valiant soul who rose up against evil. Or perhaps not. The truth lies amidst the
blinding light.
column4:
Such radiance, such magnificence.
   - The Wandering Minstrel

column2: Summon forth the Jibanyan couch. A mysterious piece of furniture designed in the likeness of a Yo-kai named Jibanyan.
column3: Despite being modeled upon Jibanyan, an Earthbound Yo-kai, this couch is able to fly. It is said to be so comfortable as to turn men and Yo-Kai alike into useless layabouts.
column4:
Sluggards! Layabouts!
Good-for-nothing reprobates!
   - Seigetsu the Enlightened

column2: Call into battle your magitek hyperconveyor, a modern-day improvement on ancient Allagan logistics.
column3:
Guided as ever by the ethos of constant advancement, imperial magitek engineers returned to improve their conveyor system, simplifying its assembly and trimming weight by 8%. The result is enhanced fuel efficiency, demonstrating that even
world-conquering empires can
be environmentally minded.
column4:
Hah! Success!
   - Aulus mal Asina

column2: Summon forth Ehll Tou, the young dragon with a passion for crafting.
column3:
First encountered as a curious dragonet, Ehll Tou became a dragon grown during her stay in Ishgard. With her passion for crafting, she underwent an evolution heretofore unseen in her kind, developing dexterous forelimbs that
allow her to deftly wield
all manner of implements.
column4:
You have a knack
for this, Ehll Tou!
   - Hautdilong

column2: Summon forth Incitatus, an enchanted steed favored of the merchant Rowena. If it could talk, it would doubtless drive a hard bargain.
column3:
Under the patronage of its mistress, Rowena, this enchanted steed has led a pampered life. Able to comprehend language, it was often seen attending Khloe Aliapoh's storytelling sessions, her tales of high adventure inspiring it to set
out on one of its own.
column4:
Your loyal steed awaits!
   - Voyce
